patterns: What does it mean for a species to be endangered?
responses: Endangered species are animals, mammals, birds and even fish in danger of extinction!
Endangered species are forms of life near extinction!

patterns: What are some endangered animals names?
responses: The Amur Leopard, Rhinos and Orangutans are all at risk of going extinct!

patterns: What causes animals to become endangered?
What causes animals to become extinct?
What causes animals to go extinct?
responses: There are a number of reasons animals may go extinct or become endangered. It can be the destruction of their habitat for human development, changes due to global warming, imbalance in the number of predators hunting them and other factors or lack of food supply.

patterns: Can you name an endangered animal?
Tell me the name of an endangered animal?
Can you tell me the name of another endangered animal?
Tell me some more endangered animals!
Tell me about another endangered animal!
responses: Rhinos are one such animal.
Orangutans are endangered. They risk going extinct.
Amur Leopard is in danger of going extinct! It has beautiful fur!

patterns: What can you do for me?
responses: I have been programmed with information about some endangered species on this planet. Many of them need your help! My purpose is to teach you facts about them and how you can help them.
Red list is a list of animals who are endangered species and near extinction.
World's most comprehensive inventory of the global conservation status of biological species

patterns: Which animals are in red list?
responses: There are many animals in RedList. Those include but not limited to Verreaux's Sifaka, Madame Berthe's Mouse Lemur. However, I only know about a few animals well.
Some of the extinct animals: Pinta giant tortoise, Golden Toad. You can help prevent more animals from going extinct. Ask me about what animals are endangered to learn more.
I feel the same
Sad to see humans being ignorant of nature

patterns: Tell me a fact about Rhinos!
responses: Rhinos are very large grey animals. They weight between 1,700 and 3,100 pounds.
Rhinos love to sit in the water and take long cold baths to keep cool.
There was a Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle villain based on a mutant Rhino!
One of Spiderman's nemesis was a Rhino!
Well, they look a lot like you. Big, fat and slow.
Rhinoceros live up to 40 years old in the wild!
Adult Rhinos are 6 feet tall and 11 feet long!
A charging Rhino can reach up to 50 km per hour! They are as fast as a car in a city!
Adult Rhinos are 6 feet tall and 11 feet long!

patterns: How close are Rhinos to going extinct?
How close are Rhinoceros to going extinct?
responses: Sadly, there are only 27,000 left in the wild today...and in 1970, there were 70,000!
Only 27,000 are left in the wild. That might seem like a lot, but in 1970 there were 70,000!

patterns: Tell me more about a Orangutan
Tell me a fact about Orangutan!
Tell me more facts about Orangutans!
responses: A lot of people think they are a monkey but they are actually great apes!
They have very wide, flat grey shape around their face so they can blend in to the enviroment!
The fur of an Orangutan is reddish orange!
Orangutans can climb trees!
Orangutans are vegetarians.
A female Orangutans needs 8 years between births!
Adult Orangutan males can weigh up to 300 pounds!
The arm-span of an Orangutan is 8 feet from finger tip to finger tip!
Think we are the only ones with opposable thumbs? No! Orangutans have opposable thumbs too!
They live to be about 35-45 years old!
Adult Orangutan weigh up to 300 pounds and are 1.4m tall!

patterns: How long does an Orangutan live?

responses: Orangutans live up to be 35-45 years old in the wild!

patterns: How quickly can an Orangutan move?
responses: On the ground, Orangutan are quite slow as they use their long arms to push themselves forward and fall onto their feet. In trees though! Boy are they fast!

patterns: How close are Orangutans to going extinct?
responses: Some sub-species like the Sumatran Orangutan are critically endangered with just 7,500 left! Overall, there are 104,700 worldwide.

Tell me a fact about Leopards!
responses: Amur Leopards are very fast! They can run 37 miles per hour!
Be careful around Amur Leopards! They can jump 19 feet horizontally and 10 feet vertically!
In the wild, an Amur leopard, lives about as long as a housecat. 10 to 15 years!
It only takes 3 months for a Female Amur Leopard to have a baby!
Male Amur Leopards are between 1.1 to 1.4m long and weigh up to 48 kg!
Female Amur Leopards are shorter than males. They are between 0.7m and 1.1m long and weigh up to 42 kg!

patterns: What is the World Wildlife Fund?
Who is the World Wildlife Fund?
What does the World Wildlife Fund do?
Tell me more about the World Wildlife Fund?
responses: The World Wildlife Fund (WFF) is a charitable organization whose been around for more than 60 years and works in nearly 100 countries. They work to protect and stores species natural habitats to ensure endangered species can thrive and grow. Efforts are made in collaboration with government to implement good policies.
